block.p: Linn Cary Parrish and David Charles Elmes were married yesterday at the South Congregational Church in Centerville, Mass. The Rev. Dr. Robert Singer performed the ceremony.

The bride, 39, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a senior managing director specializing in consumer marketing in Boston for BSMG Worldwide, a public relations firm. She graduated from St. Lawrence University. She is a daughter of Susan Bianchi of Boston and Thomas K. Parrish III of Waitsfield, Vt. The bride's father is a management and marketing consultant in Waitsfield. Her mother owns the Parrish Marketing Group in Boston. The bride is a stepdaughter of Lawrence A. Bianchi, who retired as the chairman of the Codman Company, a commercial real estate concern in Boston.
Linn Cary Parrish and David Charles Elmes were married yesterday at the South Congregational Church in Centerville, Mass. The Rev. Dr. Robert Singer performed the ceremony.

The bride, 39, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a senior managing director specializing in consumer marketing in Boston for BSMG Worldwide, a public relations firm. She graduated from St. Lawrence University. She is a daughter of Susan Bianchi of Boston and Thomas K. Parrish III of Waitsfield, Vt. The bride's father is a management and marketing consultant in Waitsfield. Her mother owns the Parrish Marketing Group in Boston. The bride is a stepdaughter of Lawrence A. Bianchi, who retired as the chairman of the Codman Company, a commercial real estate concern in Boston.

The bridegroom, 40, is a senior consultant at Creative Data, a data storage and Internet services company in Lexington, Mass. He graduated from Hamilton College and received a J.D. degree from Boston College. He is a son of Barbara B. Elmes of Weston, Mass., and the late Charles F. Elmes. His father was a partner in Bowker, Elmes, Perkins, Mecsas & Gerrard, a law firm that was in Boston.
The couple began dating in August 1998 while training for the Hyannis Sprint II Triathlon, which took place later that year in Centerville. They both completed the race.
